configfiles.configfile:
@CMD_imports@
#if $method.method == 'pp.make_fragment_file' sa.pp.make_fragment_file( bam_file = '$method.bam_file', output_file = '$method.output_file', is_paired = $method.is_paired, barcode_tag = '$method.barcode_tag', barcode_regex = '$method.barcode_regex', umi_tag = '$method.umi_tag', umi_regex = '$method.umi_regex', shift_right = $method.shift_right, shift_left = $method.shift_left, min_mapq = $method.min_mapq, chunk_size = $method.chunk_size, compression = '$method.compression', compression_level = $method.compression_level, )
#else if $method.method == 'pp.import_data' import json import pandas as pd import csv with open('$method.chrom_sizes') as f: chr_sizes = {x[0]:int(x[1]) for x in csv.reader(f, delimiter='\t')}
sa.pp.import_data( fragment_file = '$method.fragment_file', chrom_sizes = chr_sizes, min_num_fragments = $method.min_num_fragments, sorted_by_barcode = $method.sorted_by_barcode, #if str($method.whitelist) != 'None' whitelist = '$method.whitelist', #end if shift_left = $method.shift_left, shift_right = $method.shift_right, #set $chr_mt = ([x.strip() for x in str($method.chrM).split(',')]) chrM = $chr_mt, chunk_size = $method.chunk_size, file = 'anndata.h5ad' )
#else if $method.method == 'pp.add_tile_matrix' @CMD_read_inputs@ sa.pp.add_tile_matrix( adata, bin_size = $method.bin_size, inplace = True, chunk_size = $method.chunk_size, #if $method.exclude_chroms #set $excl_chroms = ([x.strip() for x in str($method.exclude_chroms).split(',')]) exclude_chroms = $excl_chroms, #end if #if $method.min_frag_size min_frag_size = $method.min_frag_size, #end if #if $method.max_frag_size max_frag_size = $method.max_frag_size, #end if count_frag_as_reads = $method.count_frag_as_reads, ) adata.close()
#else if $method.method == 'pp.make_peak_matrix' @CMD_read_inputs@ sa.pp.make_peak_matrix( adata, use_rep = '$method.use_rep', inplace = True, backend= 'hdf5', peak_file = '$method.peak_file', chunk_size = $method.chunk_size, use_x = $method.use_x, min_frag_size = $method.min_frag_size, max_frag_size = $method.max_frag_size ) adata.close()
#else if $method.method == 'pp.make_gene_matrix' @CMD_read_inputs@ sa.pp.make_gene_matrix( adata, gene_anno = '$method.gene_anno', inplace = True, backend= 'hdf5', chunk_size = $method.chunk_size, use_x = $method.use_x, id_type = '$method.id_type', transcript_name_key = '$method.transcript_name_key', transcript_id_key = '$method.transcript_id_key', gene_name_key = '$method.gene_name_key', gene_id_key = '$method.gene_id_key', min_frag_size = $method.min_frag_size, max_frag_size = $method.max_frag_size, count_frag_as_reads =$method.count_frag_as_reads ) adata.close()
#else if $method.method == 'pp.filter_cells' @CMD_read_inputs@ sa.metrics.tsse(adata, gene_anno='$method.gene_anno') sa.pp.filter_cells( adata, min_counts = $method.min_counts, min_tsse = $method.min_tsse, #if $method.max_counts max_counts = $method.max_counts, #end if #if $method.max_tsse max_tsse = $method.max_tsse, #end if inplace = True ) adata.close()
#else if $method.method == 'pp.select_features' @CMD_read_inputs@ sa.pp.select_features( adata, n_features = $method.n_features, filter_lower_quantile = $method.filter_lower_quantile, filter_upper_quantile = $method.filter_upper_quantile, #if $method.whitelist whitelist = '$method.whitelist', #end if #if $method.blacklist blacklist = '$method.blacklist', #end if max_iter = $method.max_iter, inplace = True, verbose = False ) adata.close()
#else if $method.method == 'pp.knn' @CMD_read_inputs@ sa.pp.knn( adata, n_neighbors = $method.n_neighbors, use_dims = $method.use_dims, use_rep = '$method.use_rep', method = '$method.method', inplace = True, random_state = $method.random_state ) adata.close()
#else if $method.method == 'pp.scrublet' @CMD_read_inputs@ sa.pp.scrublet( adata, #if $method.features features = '$method.features', #end if n_comps = $method.n_comps, sim_doublet_ratio = $method.sim_doublet_ratio, expected_doublet_rate = $method.expected_doublet_rate, #if $method.n_neighbors n_neighbors = $method.n_neighbors, #end if use_approx_neighbors = $method.use_approx_neighbors, random_state = $method.random_state, inplace = True, verbose = False ) adata.close()
#else if $method.method == 'pp.filter_doublets' @CMD_read_inputs@ sa.pp.filter_doublets( adata, #if $method.probability_threshold probability_threshold = $method.probability_threshold, #end if #if $method.score_threshold score_threshold = $method.score_threshold, #end if inplace = True, verbose = False ) adata.close()
#else if $method.method == 'pp.mnc_correct' @CMD_read_inputs@ sa.pp.mnc_correct( adata, batch = '$method.batch', n_neighbors = $method.n_neighbors,nnotated data matr n_clusters = $method.n_clusters, n_iter = $method.n_iter, use_rep = '$method.use_rep', use_dims = $method.use_dims, groupby = '$method.groupby', key_added = '$method.key_added', inplace = True, ) adata.close()
#else if $method.method == 'pp.harmony' @CMD_read_inputs@ sa.pp.harmony( adata, batch = '$method.batch', use_rep = '$method.use_rep', use_dims = $method.use_dims, groupby = '$method.groupby', key_added = '$method.key_added', inplace = True ) adata.close()
#else if $method.method == 'pp.scanorama_integrate' @CMD_read_inputs@ sa.pp.scanorama_integrate( adata, batch = '$method.batch', n_neighbors = $method.n_neighbors, use_rep = '$method.use_rep', use_dims = $method.use_dims, groupby = '$method.groupby', key_added = '$method.key_added', inplace = True ) adata.close()
#end if

param.name: method
param.label: Method used for preprocessing
param.option: Convert a BAM file to a fragment file, using pp.make_fragment_file
Import data fragment files and compute basic QC metrics, using pp.import_data
Generate cell by bin count matrix, using pp.add_tile_matrix
Generate cell by peak count matrix, using pp.make_peak_matrix
Generate cell by gene activity matrix, using pp.make_gene_matrix
Filter cell outliers based on counts and numbers of genes expressed, using pp.filter_cells
Perform feature selection, using pp.select_features
Compute a neighborhood graph of observations, using pp.knn
Compute probability of being a doublet using the scrublet algorithm, using pp.scrublet
Remove doublets according to the doublet probability or doublet score, using pp.filter_doublets
A modified MNN-Correct algorithm based on cluster centroid, using pp.mnc_correct
Use harmonypy to integrate different experiments,using pp.harmony
Use Scanorama [Hie19] to integrate different experiments, using pp.scanorama_integrate

param.name: bam_file
param.label: File name of the BAM file

param.name: output_file
param.label: File name of the output fragment file

param.name: is_paired
param.label: Indicate whether the BAM file contain paired-end reads

param.name: barcode_tag
param.label: Extract barcodes from TAG fields of BAM records

param.name: barcode_regex
param.label: Extract barcodes from read names of BAM records using regular expressions

param.name: umi_tag
param.label: Extract UMI from TAG fields of BAM records

param.name: umi_regex
param.label: Extract UMI from read names of BAM records using regular expressions

param.name: min_mapq
param.label: Filter the reads based on MAPQ

param.name: chunk_size
param.label: chunk size

param.name: compression
param.label: Compression type
param.option: gzip
zstandard

param.name: compression_level
param.label: Compression level

param.name: fragment_file
param.label: Fragment file, optionally compressed with gzip or zstd

param.name: chrom_sizes
param.label: A tabular file containing chromosome names and sizes

param.name: min_num_fragments
param.label: Number of unique fragments threshold used to filter cells

param.name: sorted_by_barcode
param.label: Whether the fragment file has been sorted by cell barcodes

param.name: whitelist
param.label: Whitelist file with a list of barcodes
param.help: Each line must contain a valid barcode. When provided, only barcodes in the whitelist will be retained.

param.name: shift_left
param.label: Insertion site correction for the left end
param.help: Note this has no effect on single-end reads

param.name: shift_right
param.label: Insertion site correction for the right end
param.help: Note this has no effect on single-end reads

param.name: chrM
param.label: A list of chromosome names that are considered mitochondrial DNA

param.name: chunk_size
param.label: chunk size

param.name: bin_size
param.label: The size of consecutive genomic regions used to record the counts

param.name: exclude_chroms
param.label: A list of chromosomes to exclude

param.name: count_frag_as_reads
param.label: Whether to count fragments as reads

param.name: use_rep
param.label: Used to read peak information from .uns[use_rep]

param.name: peak_file
param.label: Bed file containing the peaks

param.name: use_x
param.label: If True, use the matrix stored in .X as raw counts

param.name: count_frag_as_reads
param.label: Whether to count fragments as reads

param.name: gene_anno
param.label: Either a Genome object or the path of a gene annotation file in GFF or GTF format

param.name: use_x
param.label: If True, use the matrix stored in .X as raw counts

param.name: id_type
param.label: “gene” or “transcript”
param.option: gene
transcript

param.name: transcript_name_key
param.label: The key of the transcript name in the gene annotation file

param.name: transcript_id_key
param.label: The key of the transcript id in the gene annotation file

param.name: gene_name_key
param.label: The key of the gene name in the gene annotation file

param.name: gene_id_key
param.label: The key of the gene id in the gene annotation file

param.name: count_frag_as_reads
param.label: Whether to count fragments as reads

param.name: min_counts
param.label: Minimum number of counts required for a cell to pass filtering

param.name: min_tsse
param.label: Minimum TSS enrichemnt score required for a cell to pass filtering

param.name: max_counts
param.label: Maximum number of counts required for a cell to pass filtering

param.name: max_tsse
param.label: Maximum TSS enrichment score expressed required for a cell to pass filtering

param.name: gene_anno
param.label: GTF/GFF file containing the gene annotation

param.name: n_features
param.label: Number of features to keep

param.name: filter_lower_quantile
param.label: Lower quantile of the feature count distribution to filter out

param.name: filter_upper_quantile
param.label: Upper quantile of the feature count distribution to filter out

param.name: whitelist
param.label: A user provided bed file containing genome-wide whitelist regions

param.name: blacklist
param.label: A user provided bed file containing genome-wide blacklist regions

param.name: max_iter
param.label: If greater than 1, this function will perform iterative clustering and feature selection

param.name: n_neighbors
param.label: The number of nearest neighbors to be searched

param.name: use_dims
param.label: The dimensions used for computation

param.name: use_rep
param.label: The key for the matrix

param.name: method
param.label: Choose method
param.option: kdtree
hora
pynndescent

param.name: random_state
param.label: Random seed for approximate nearest neighbor search

param.name: features
param.label: Boolean index mask, where True means that the feature is kept, and False means the feature is removed.

param.name: n_comps
param.label: Number of components

param.name: sim_doublet_ratio
param.label: Number of doublets to simulate relative to the number of observed cells

param.name: expected_doublet_rate
param.label: Expected doublet rate

param.name: n_neighbors
param.label: Number of neighbors used to construct the KNN graph of observed cells and simulated doublets

param.name: use_approx_neighbors
param.label: Whether to use approximate search

param.name: random_state
param.label: Random state

param.name: probability_threshold
param.label: Threshold for doublet probability

param.name: score_threshold
param.label: Threshold for doublet score

param.name: batch
param.label: Batch labels for cells

param.name: n_neighbors
param.label: Number of mutual nearest neighbors

param.name: n_clusters
param.label: Number of clusters

param.name: n_iter
param.label: Number of iterations

param.name: batch
param.label: Batch labels for cells

param.name: batch
param.label: Batch labels for cells

param.name: n_neighbors
param.label: Number of mutual nearest neighbors
